586AC6DA47584944AEA4CD755CA50A65.description:
Students work with
others, using collaborative
technologies to explore local
and global issues and
investigate and advocate for
possible solutions.

20ABD1B2013D44FABB66421F9D32046D.description:
Students perform a
variety of roles within a team,
using age-appropriate
technology to complete a project
or solve a problem.

67E9501000FE408D80CA5F349D204778.description:
Students use
collaborative technologies to
connect with others, including
peers, experts and community
members, to learn about issues
and problems or to gain a
broader perspective.

E8BB9B9645344012A41D248F45D2CFF5.description:
Students use digital
tools to interact with others to
develop a richer understanding
of different perspectives and
cultures.

B81AA985B50B4B71802B13837A9548FE.description:
Standard 7. Global Collaborator - Students use digital tools to broaden their perspectives and enrich their learning by
collaborating with others and working effectively in teams locally and globally.

54071CD247434946BEDD79D82BA8605B.description:
Students publish or
present content designed for
intended audiences and select
platforms that effectively convey
their ideas.

3E71DBA041C6412890A7D24ACDB8DB45.description:
Students create artifacts
using digital tools to
communicate complex ideas
textually, visually, graphically,
and auditorily.

71E84375EAD543618D483762C01A7360.description:
Students create
original works or responsibly
repurpose digital resources
into new creative works.

EEAF7052E766420E9D11D4A910C25C73.description:
Students select
appropriate platforms and tools
to create, share, and
communicate their work
effectively.

7DA35B38C94B4AC98B705EEC73C93440.description:
Creative Communicator - Students communicate clearly and express themselves creatively for a variety of
purposes using the platforms, tools, styles, formats and digital media appropriate to their goals.

3B673D95DE4E48F5A93DD89AFBEE5AB3.description:
Students understand how
automation works and apply
algorithmic thinking to design and
automate solutions.

23156D73EFCC4199AADF1F974052A8AD.description:
Students break
problems into component parts,
identify key pieces, and use
that information to solve
problems.

3F442DAE5B344C358C3940B5D9E704DB.description:
Students find and
organize data and use technology
to analyze and represent it to
solve problems and make
decisions.

B2FFF576DAA74FBC853A1BD0FC0047F1.description:
Students practice
defining and solving problems
by selecting technology for
data analysis, modeling, and
algorithmic thinking.

DD7A605AE7344CDB8E44FA50602795B4.description:
Computational Thinker - Students develop and employ strategies for understanding and solving problems in
ways that leverage the power of technological methods to develop and test solutions.

C7B58472DBF74B87A46327598CEC54DF.description:
Students demonstrate an
ability to persevere and handle
greater ambiguity as they work to
solve open-ended problems.

7DEC7725455C4D6790DEF32D6E9BB1E9.description:
Students engage in a
design process to develop, test,
and revise prototypes, embrace
the iterative process of trial and
error, and understand setbacks
as potential opportunities for
improvement.

C71450A2475D40519E9AA5714AFBCF87.description:
Students select and use
digital tools to support a design
process and expand their
understanding to identify
constraints and trade-offs and to
weigh risks.

04212F8B453B40A69DAFF0FF91DFB114.description:
Students engage in a
design process for generating
and testing ideas and developing
innovative products to solve
problems.

9A89C69CE20C42F6B4CBB9646CABE1C7.description:
Innovative Designer - Students use a variety of technologies within a design process to identify and solve
problems by creating new, useful or imaginative solutions.

CB2E55C1CAAF4EE48D1AF881A15E9D31.description:
Students explore real-world problems and issues and
actively pursue solutions for
them.

4A487AC4A038415FA5EB1033F634B404.description:
Students locate and
collect a variety of resources
and organize information to
make meaningful connections.

727D7B4CAD7849E1A3BFC5E582A7DBDF.description:
Students practice
evaluating the accuracy,
perspective, credibility, and
relevance of information,
media, data or other resources.

1262BD3E1B3C496F87EF9AF7DE5A5105.description:
Students practice and
improve research strategies to
locate information and other
resources for their intellectual or
creative pursuits.

D5FDEFAABC984E3B9F572DC0D276A86B.description:
Knowledge Constructor - Students critically curate a variety of resources using digital tools to construct
knowledge, produce creative artifacts, and make meaningful learning experiences for themselves and others.

544DE277BAA8495889479CC2DA8006BD.description:
Students demonstrate an
understanding of what personal
data is, how it is collected, and
how to keep it private and secure,
including the awareness of current
technology terms and processes.

C880A307360546B6923817F19CFB9C7E.description:
Students demonstrate
and advocate for an
understanding of intellectual
property including copyright,
permission, and fair use by
including appropriate citation
and attribution elements.

554E230559544E329AA7FE57AD4E7073.description:
Students demonstrate
and advocate for positive, safe,
legal, and ethical behavior when
using technology and when
interacting with others online.

100569ED2B5140E794A5EBC7B311AD2F.description:
Students cultivate their
digital identities and reputations
within a digital environment and
understand that digital actions
are permanent.

64DCBB49DBFC402BB5BAEB59F8E5B4E6.description:
Digital Citizen - Students recognize the rights, responsibilities, and opportunities of living, learning, and
working in an interconnected digital world, and they act and model in ways that are safe, legal, and ethical.

9F9DB94DD64A449592013A0C98D20D2A.description:
Students navigate a
variety of technologies and
transfer their skills to
troubleshoot and learn how to
use new technologies.

173F8389103A42D2BA93233A0E5AFA9C.description:
Students integrate
feedback from people and digital
tools to improve their learning
process, and they select
technology to demonstrate their
learning in a variety of ways.

1B537A6C10CF41D9B5FEFEF1A9EEB1C2.description:
Students identify and
begin to develop online networks
of experts and peers to
customize their learning
environments in accordance with
school policy.

22779BA1CDE64842BBAA316512EFD1FB.description:
Students articulate
personal learning goals, select,
and manage appropriate
technologies to achieve them,
and reflect on their successes
and areas of improvement in
working toward their goals.

8497EEF385974589B263A251D0A6D7CC.description:
Empowered Learner - Students leverage technology to take an active role in choosing, achieving, and
demonstrating competency in their learning goals, informed by the learning sciences.
